content:
Sporting CP has implemented several strategies in expanding their soccer operations beyond Portugal, including:

1. Establishing international partnerships: Sporting CP has formed partnerships with several clubs around the world, including the MLS team New York City FC and the Chinese club Shandong Luneng. These partnerships involve exchanges of players, coaches, and expertise to help develop the sport in different regions.

2. Investing in scouting: The club has invested heavily in scouting talent around the world, with a particular focus on Africa and South America. This has allowed them to identify promising young players and bring them to Portugal to develop their skills in the Sporting CP academy.

3. Building a global brand: Sporting CP has worked to establish its brand on a global scale, with international marketing efforts focused on building relationships with fans and promoting the club's values and traditions.

4. International training camps: In addition to scouting talent, Sporting CP has organized international training camps in countries such as Angola and Mozambique, where players can receive top-quality coaching and training.

5. Expanding Youth Academies: Sporting CP is also expanding its youth academies, building partnerships with local clubs and developing sporting facilities. This will allow Sporting CP to identify young football players, support them from an early age, and guide their development over time. 

Overall, Sporting CP has taken a proactive approach to expanding its soccer operations beyond Portugal, leveraging partnerships, scouting, branding, and youth development to build a world-class soccer club.
